summary: I am a Mechanical Engineer currently based within the Netherlands. I have previously worked within several sectors, including the food, oil & gas, manufacturing and chemical industries and I am seeking a new opportunity that will utilise and apply my engineering knowledge, understanding and experience - to play a part in leading the way to shape our global future.

awards.title: Overall Committee of the Year, 2017
awards.description:
This award recognises the hard work undertaken by the Hall Committee throughout the year; Against 16 other halls. 

This was the first time John Phillips Hall has ever won anything at the Hall Committee Awards.
awards.issuer: Hersh Patel, Financial and Commercial Services EO

profile_positions.description:
•	Working within the UK/IE and other smaller markets to provide the customer support and sales via multiple channels using the SalesForce CRM software. 
•	Taking ownership and becoming the single point of contact for the UK/IE market - forming a vital link between other markets, retail, supply chain and marketing. 
•	Nominated for the ‘Zen Master of Wisdom’ (the most helpful and supportive colleague by colleagues for 5 months in a row and winning this).
•	Using my engineering and logical mindset to observe patterns in data and trends to find underlying causes and find solutions before situations escalate. 
•	Receiving 100% in qualities 2 months in a row. and an average of over 90%. 
•	Actively involved in CRM improvement projects, process improvements creating trainings for colleagues in other markets whom support my market.
profile_positions.title: Customer Relations & Sales

profile_positions.description:
Mostly based in the mechanical workshop, following technical drawings and manufacturing bespoke grinding and milling machines, primarily for the chocolate industry. 

This included some of the following tasks:
o	Assembling parts and components as per engineering drawings and specifications, using correct bonding techniques.
o	Making modifications as per engineering/customer requirement. 
o	Calibrating and adjusting devices for correct operation and control. 
o	Performing quality and fault analysis to ensure specifications have been met. 
o	Proactively liaising with the design engineering team to discuss potential process improvements – mainly found when solving problems encountered during production.
o	Ability to use all workshop machines, including lathes, mills, drills, welding equipment (basic tac welding) and grinding machines. 

I also travelled abroad to visit clients to install, commission, troubleshoot and train operators on how to use the machines correctly and safely, whilst explaining process relevance.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Technician/Field Service Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Worked on multiple projects for large clients such as Shell, using Solidworks, Inventor and 
		AutoCAD to generate an extensive 3D model and subsequent 2D engineering
		drawings suitable for manufacture.
	•	Gained knowledge and experience in conducting pipeline and pressure vessel 
		calculations to standards such as ASME B31.6 and EN13480. 
	•	Used Finite Element Analysis software to ensure designs meet the guidelines and 
		do not exceed the maximum allowable stress.
	•	Worked together with the senior mechanical engineer to ensure technical 
		documents have been correctly prepared to the client’s standards and on time.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.location: Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, United Kingdom
profile_positions.description:
• Two year development programme with rotational placements leading to a Senior Management position within the business. 

Process engineering:
• Gained extensive technical knowledge in the complex processes involved with sugar production. This includes: raw material processing, juice refining, animal feed production, bioethanol production and combined heat and power generation. 

Project management:	
• Responsible for the management of a cost reduction Capex project worth £50k to increase the chemical system’s capacity and reduce cost per tonne of chemical usage. 
• Full management of the project including the creation of the design specification, checking the quality of drawings, plant decomissioning, installation and contractor management. 
• Delivered the project on time, under budget and with a return on investment of 50% per annum. 

Maintenance engineering:
• Responsible for the planning and scheduling of daily proactive and reactive engineering work, co-ordinating a team of 15 engineers and contractors on a daily basis. 
• Ensuring business compliance targets are met through statutory and mandatory preventative maintenance of plant items. 
• Conducting assessments of plant items to meet PUWER regulations.

Training/Certification:
• Gained accredited Lean Six Sigma training to deliver a Continuous Improvement project. 
• Completed an IOSH Managing Safely training course and assessment successfully.

Extra-curricular:
• Represented the company within the local community by organising and leading an engineering day for local schoolchildren to promote engineering as a career.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description: Team Leader, Promotional Consultant, Customer Service Agent.
profile_positions.title: Promotional Consultant
